alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Yakutat (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 13 at 1:50AM AKDT until October 13 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM AKDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following area, Situk River near Yakutat, along the Northeast Gulf Coast. * WHEN...Until 545 PM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 143 AM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 3 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - For Situk River near Yakutat: At 1:30am the stage was 71.08 feet. Flood Stage is 71.5 feet. Forecast: An estimated crest around 71.8 feet is expected around 9:00am Thursday. Impacts: At 70.5 feet: Bankfull stage. At 71.5 feet: Minor flooding is expected near 9 mile bridge with water beginning to encroach and flood the boat launch along with the surrounding campground. The Lost River and Tawa Creek will begin to go over their banks. At 72.2 feet: Minor flooding is expected near the 9 mile bridge and surrounding campground/boat launch. There will be significant erosion of the trail system along the Situk River. Water up to one foot will flow over the low spots on Forest highway #10, Cannon Beach Rd, near Tawa Creek and Lost River. Water will start to encroach the east end of the runway of the airport. Endicott Rd and Glacier Bear Rd will be flooded. - If you live near or along Situk River stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
